title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there are no children node listings available.
EB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children nodes should be listed properly based on the new data source.
SR:
1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 
2. Open the data set editor and navigate to the data source page. 
3. Change the data source to a new one. 
4. Verify that the new data source's database, table, and column information are properly listed as children nodes in the data set editor page. 
5. If the children nodes are not listed, close the data set editor and reopen it to see if the issue persists.
